class.name: Skeleton3D
class.brief_description: Skeleton for characters and animated objects.
class.description: Skeleton3D provides a hierarchical interface for managing bones, including pose, rest and animation (see [Animation]). It can also use ragdoll physics. The overall transform of a bone with respect to the skeleton is determined by the following hierarchical order: rest pose, custom pose and pose. Note that "global pose" below refers to the overall transform of the bone with respect to skeleton, so it not the actual global/world transform of the bone.

method.name: add_bone
method.description: Adds a bone, with name [code]name[/code]. [method get_bone_count] will become the bone index.

method.name: add_bone_child
method.description: Takes the given bone pose/transform and converts it to a world transform, relative to the [Skeleton3D] node. This is useful for using the bone transform in calculations with transforms from [Node3D]-based nodes.

method.name: clear_bones
method.description: Clear all the bones in this skeleton.

method.name: clear_bones_global_pose_override
method.description: Removes the global pose override on all bones in the skeleton.

method.name: clear_bones_local_pose_override
method.description: Removes the local pose override on all bones in the skeleton.

method.name: execute_modifications
method.description: Executes all the modifications on the [SkeletonModificationStack3D], if the Skeleton3D has one assigned.

method.name: find_bone
method.description: Returns the bone index that matches [code]name[/code] as its name.

method.name: force_update_all_bone_transforms
method.description: Force updates the bone transforms/poses for all bones in the skeleton.

method.name: force_update_bone_child_transform
method.description: Force updates the bone transform for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code] and all of its children.

method.name: get_bone_children
method.description: Returns an array containing the bone indexes of all the children node of the passed in bone, [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: get_bone_count
method.description: Returns the amount of bones in the skeleton.

method.name: get_bone_global_pose
method.description: Returns the overall transform of the specified bone, with respect to the skeleton. Being relative to the skeleton frame, this is not the actual "global" transform of the bone.

method.name: get_bone_global_pose_no_override
method.description: Returns the overall transform of the specified bone, with respect to the skeleton, but without any global pose overrides. Being relative to the skeleton frame, this is not the actual "global" transform of the bone.

method.name: get_bone_local_pose_override
method.description: Returns the local pose override transform for [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: get_bone_name
method.description: Returns the name of the bone at index [code]index[/code].

method.name: get_bone_parent
method.description: Returns the bone index which is the parent of the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. If -1, then bone has no parent. [b]Note:[/b] The parent bone returned will always be less than [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: get_bone_pose
method.description: Returns the pose transform of the specified bone. Pose is applied on top of the custom pose, which is applied on top the rest pose.

method.name: get_bone_rest
method.description: Returns the rest transform for a bone [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: get_modification_stack
method.description: Returns the modification stack attached to this skeleton, if one exists.

method.name: get_parentless_bones
method.description: Returns an array with all of the bones that are parentless. Another way to look at this is that it returns the indexes of all the bones that are not dependent or modified by other bones in the Skeleton.

method.name: global_pose_to_local_pose
method.description: Takes the passed-in global pose and converts it to local pose transform. This can be used to easily convert a global pose from [method get_bone_global_pose] to a global transform in [method set_bone_local_pose_override].

method.name: global_pose_to_world_transform
method.description: Takes the passed-in global pose and converts it to a world transform. This can be used to easily convert a global pose from [method get_bone_global_pose] to a global transform usable with a node's transform, like [member Node3D.global_transform] for example.

method.name: global_pose_z_forward_to_bone_forward
method.description: Rotates the given [Basis] so that the forward axis of the Basis is facing in the forward direction of the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. This is helper function to make using [method Transform3D.looking_at] easier with bone poses.

method.name: is_bone_enabled
method.description: Returns whether the bone pose for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code] is enabled.

method.name: local_pose_to_global_pose
method.description: Converts the passed-in local pose to a global pose relative to the inputted bone, [code]bone_idx[/code]. This could be used to convert [method get_bone_pose] for use with the [method set_bone_global_pose_override] function.

method.name: localize_rests
method.description: Returns all bones in the skeleton to their rest poses.

method.name: physical_bones_add_collision_exception
method.description: Adds a collision exception to the physical bone. Works just like the [RigidDynamicBody3D] node.

method.name: physical_bones_remove_collision_exception
method.description: Removes a collision exception to the physical bone. Works just like the [RigidDynamicBody3D] node.

method.name: physical_bones_start_simulation
method.description: Tells the [PhysicalBone3D] nodes in the Skeleton to start simulating and reacting to the physics world. Optionally, a list of bone names can be passed-in, allowing only the passed-in bones to be simulated.

method.name: physical_bones_stop_simulation
method.description: Tells the [PhysicalBone3D] nodes in the Skeleton to stop simulating.

method.name: register_skin
method.description: Binds the given Skin to the Skeleton.

method.name: remove_bone_child
method.description: Removes the passed in child bone index, [code]child_bone_idx[/code], from the passed-in bone, [code]bone_idx[/code], if it exists. [b]Note:[/b] This does not remove the child bone, but instead it removes the connection it has to the parent bone.

method.name: set_bone_children
method.description: Sets the children for the passed in bone, [code]bone_idx[/code], to the passed-in array of bone indexes, [code]bone_children[/code].

method.name: set_bone_enabled
method.description: Disables the pose for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code] if [code]false[/code], enables the bone pose if [code]true[/code].

method.name: set_bone_global_pose_override
method.description: Sets the global pose transform, [code]pose[/code], for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. [code]amount[/code] is the interpolation strength that will be used when applying the pose, and [code]persistent[/code] determines if the applied pose will remain. [b]Note:[/b] The pose transform needs to be a global pose! Use [method world_transform_to_global_pose] to convert a world transform, like one you can get from a [Node3D], to a global pose.

method.name: set_bone_local_pose_override
method.description: Sets the local pose transform, [code]pose[/code], for the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. [code]amount[/code] is the interpolation strength that will be used when applying the pose, and [code]persistent[/code] determines if the applied pose will remain. [b]Note:[/b] The pose transform needs to be a local pose! Use [method global_pose_to_local_pose] to convert a global pose to a local pose.

method.name: set_bone_parent
method.description: Sets the bone index [code]parent_idx[/code] as the parent of the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code]. If -1, then bone has no parent. [b]Note:[/b] [code]parent_idx[/code] must be less than [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: set_bone_rest
method.description: Sets the rest transform for bone [code]bone_idx[/code].

method.name: set_modification_stack
method.description: Sets the modification stack for this skeleton to the passed-in modification stack, [code]modification_stack[/code].

method.name: unparent_bone_and_rest
method.description: Unparents the bone at [code]bone_idx[/code] and sets its rest position to that of its parent prior to being reset.

method.name: world_transform_to_global_pose
method.description: Takes the passed-in global transform and converts it to a global pose. This can be used to easily convert a global transform from [member Node3D.global_transform] to a global pose usable with [method set_bone_global_pose_override], for example.

signal.name: bone_pose_changed
signal.description: This signal is emitted when one of the bones in the Skeleton3D node have changed their pose. This is used to inform nodes that rely on bone positions that one of the bones in the Skeleton3D have changed their transform/pose.
